text.__SUMMARY__: Entoloma cetratum is a common, inedible mushroom of the genus Entoloma. It is mostly found from May, in coniferous forest, among moss.
text.Description:
The cap is broadly conical to convex, light amber-brown, ribbed, and grows up to 3 cm in diameter. It is ribbed almost to the centre.
The gills are salmon pink and sinuate. The spores are pink. The stem is light brown, longitudinally fibrous and slender.
text.References: E. Garnweidner. Mushrooms and Toadstools of Britain and Europe. Collins. 1994.
